intro: Microcorys, commonly known as the narrow-leafed microcorys, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. These plants are characterized by their slender, often aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers. They typically grow in temperate regions and are often found in moist, well-drained soils. Microcorys species are known for their medicinal properties and have been used in traditional herbal remedies. Their botanical features make them valuable for both ecological and pharmaceutical research.
